content: storm rondo shawl by kari jo ruden this luminous shawl is created using only knit purl simple increases and slipped stitches the increases occur on the right side only making a nice shape with neat edges that knits up quite quickly with truboo yarn the pattern is very easy to memorize and travel with-the three different sections of textures work together like a classic rondo a-b-a-c-a with a beautiful coda and picot bind off to end the piece yarn 3 skeins lion brand truboo yarn in silver or 723 yards similar dk weight needles us size 6 circular gauge 23 sts x 27 row key abbreviations co = cast on k = knit p = purl sl = slip_stitch purlwise from left needle to right without knitting yo = yarn over kfb = knit front back wyif = with yarn in front wyib = with yarn in back rs = right side of blanket all odd numbered row ws = wrong side of blanket all even numbered row * repeat directions between the two * needles note not required but sometimes i find it easier to begin shawls straight needles then transfer to circular needles when the piece is too wide then i don t spend time fighting with the cable on my circular needles making the shawl smaller or larger to preserve the idea of a musical rondo of the fabric textures either decrease or increase by a complete repeat of abac i tend to not get stuck on a gauge for shawls so you could decide after you ve done a few repeats of abac and measure to decide how much longer you would want it to be size according to given directions is approx 57 long x 52 wide thank you so much for supporting me i truly hope you enjoy knitting my shawl if you have questions or find an error you can email me at rhythmfiberarts@gmail com much care has been taken with the directions and i welcome constructive feedback finished hand knitted items created using this pattern by the original purchaser may be sold please give pattern credit to me when able i would love to see your finished work- tag me on instagram @musikmamaknits this design directions and photos belong to the creator kari jo ruden please do not redistribute or reproduce this pattern and/ or my photos introduction co 3 row 1&2 knit 3 sts row 3 k kfb k 4 sts row 4 k row 5 k2 yo k2 5 sts row 6 k row 7 k p3 k a section row 1 k2 yo *k* until the last 2 stitches wyib sl2 row 2 p2 purl all until last two stitch wyif sl2 repeat row 1 & 2 until you have 28 sts ending with row 2 b section row 1 k2 yo *k2 p1* in pattern across the row always slipping the last 2 stitches of the row wyib row 2 purl all until last two stitches wyif sl2
